trans-unit.source: Normal maps are textures that add the appearance of surface detail, such as cracks and bumps, without changing the actual geometry of a model. They contain information about how meshes should reflect light, creating the illusion of much more complex geometry. This saves lots of processing power.
trans-unit.target: Normal maps are textures that add the appearance of surface detail, such as cracks and bumps, without changing the actual geometry of a model. They contain information about how meshes should reflect light, creating the illusion of much more complex geometry. This saves lots of processing power.

source.g: (Images courtesy of Paolo Cignoni, shared under Attribution-ShareAlike 1.0 Generic (CC BY-SA 1.0)

target.g: (Images courtesy of Paolo Cignoni, shared under Attribution-ShareAlike 1.0 Generic (CC BY-SA 1.0)

trans-unit.source: Normal maps usually represent small changes of the normal vector (the vector which points away from the surface). Stride uses the most common convention: the X and Y components follow the tangent and the bitangent of the surface, and the Z component follows the normal vector of the surface. This means that a value of (0, 0, 1) coincides with the normal vector and represents no change, while a value of (-1, 0, 0) tilts to the "left" (ie negative X value in the tangent (local) space).
trans-unit.target: Normal maps usually represent small changes of the normal vector (the vector which points away from the surface). Stride uses the most common convention: the X and Y components follow the tangent and the bitangent of the surface, and the Z component follows the normal vector of the surface. This means that a value of (0, 0, 1) coincides with the normal vector and represents no change, while a value of (-1, 0, 0) tilts to the "left" (ie negative X value in the tangent (local) space).

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, select the texture you want to use as a normal map.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, select the texture you want to use as a normal map.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, make sure the type is set to normal map.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, make sure the type is set to normal map.

trans-unit.source: This means Stride assumes the texture is in linear color space and converts it to a format suited for normal maps.
trans-unit.target: This means Stride assumes the texture is in linear color space and converts it to a format suited for normal maps.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, select the material you want to use the normal map.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, select the material you want to use the normal map.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, under the material Geometry properties, expand Surface.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, under the material Geometry properties, expand Surface.

trans-unit.source: Next to Normal map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and make sure Texture is selected.
trans-unit.target: Next to Normal map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and make sure Texture is selected.

trans-unit.source: Next to Normal map, click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: Next to Normal map, click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: Select the normal map texture and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the normal map texture and click OK.

trans-unit.source: For more information about materials, see Materials.
trans-unit.target: For more information about materials, see Materials.

trans-unit.source: Normal map textures have two properties in addition to the common texture properties.
trans-unit.target: Normal map textures have two properties in addition to the common texture properties.

trans-unit.source: Have positive Y components (green pixels) face up in tangent space. This option depends on the tools you use to create normal maps.
trans-unit.target: Have positive Y components (green pixels) face up in tangent space. This option depends on the tools you use to create normal maps.

trans-unit.source: For information about normal map properties in materials, see Materials — Geometry attributes.
trans-unit.target: For information about normal map properties in materials, see Materials — Geometry attributes.
